* The {@code Neuro} class is the main class for the Neuro Chatbot application.
* It handles the initialization of necessary components, such as storage, task list and UI.
* Constructs a new Neuro object that initializes the user interface and storage.
* @param filePath The path to the save-file for Neuro
* Runs the main loop of the Neuro application, processing user commands until an exit command is given.
* The {@code Parser} class handles the parsing of user input strings.
* It provides methods to parse for Neuro's commands, parse strings for
* date and time format and helper methods for Deadline and Event.
* Parses the user input string for the command to give Neuro.
* @param userCommand the user's input string to be parsed
* @return the correct Command based off the user's input
* Parses strings for a date and time format.
* @param dateTimeStr the input string that contains a date and time format
* @return a {@code LocalDateTime} object which contains data of the date and time
* @throws IllegalArgumentException when input string does not follow any expected format
public static LocalDateTime parseDateTime(String dateTimeStr) throws IllegalArgumentException {

throw new IllegalArgumentException("UH OH! The command given is missing the '/by' input for deadline."
+ "Try updating the command like 'deadline finish homework /by Mon 2359'.");
* Gets the index of '/from' in the command components array
* @param commandComponents the array containing components of the user's input command
* @return the index of '/from' in the array
throw new IllegalArgumentException("UH OH! The command given is missing the '/from' input for event."
+ "Try updating the command like 'event project meeting /from Mon 2pm /to 5pm'.");
* Gets the index of '/to' in the command components array
* @param commandComponents the array containing components of the user's input command
* @return the index of '/to' in the array
throw new IllegalArgumentException("UH OH! The command given is missing the '/to' input for event."
+ "Try updating the command like 'event project meeting /from Mon 2pm /to 5pm'.");

* The {@code Ui} class handles the user interface (UI) for the Neuro chatbot.
* It provides methods to display messages, including welcome and goodbye messages,
* and to read user input from the console.
* Constructs an Ui object and initializes a Scanner for user input.
* Shows a horizontal line divider for the text UI.
* Shows the Welcome message for Neuro.
System.out.println("    Hii, I'm Neuro, your chatbot assistant!");
System.out.println("    How can I help you?");

* Displays the given message with indentation.

ui.showMessage("You now have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* The {@code Command} class represents an abstract command that can be executed within the Neuro application.
* Executes the command with the provided task list, user interface and storage.
* @param tasks the task list on which the command operates
* @param ui the user interface for interacting with the user
* @param storage the storage for saving and loading tasks
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Indicates whether this command causes the application to exit.
* @return {@code true} if the command should cause the application to exit, {@code false} otherwise
* The {@code DeleteCommand} class represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand object with the specified index of the task to be deleted.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted from the task list.
* Executes the delete command to delete the task at the index from the task list.
* @param tasks the task list on which the command operates
* @param ui the user interface for interacting with the user
* @param storage the storage for saving and loading tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showError("Missing or invalid index for 'delete' command! Add a valid "
+ "index for a task to delete, like 'delete 2'.");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.showError("Index out of bounds! Try calling the command 'list' to "
+ "verify the index of the desired task.");
* The {@code ExitCommand} class represents a command to exit the Neuro application.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* The {@code FindCommand} class represents a command to find tasks in the task list based on a search query.
* Constructs a FindCommand object with the specified search query.
* @param searchQuery The query used to search for tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* The {@code ListCommand} class represents a command to list the tasks in the task list.
* Executes the list command to list the tasks in the task list.
* @param tasks the task list on which the command operates
* @param ui the user interface for interacting with the user
* @param storage the storage for saving and loading tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Here is a list of all your tasks:");
* The {@code MarkCommand} class represents a command to mark a task as done in the task list.
* Constructs a MarkCommand object with the specified index of the task to mark.
* @param index The index of the task to mark in the task list.
* Executes the mark command to mark the task at the index from the task list.
* @param tasks the task list on which the command operates
* @param ui the user interface for interacting with the user
* @param storage the storage for saving and loading tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showError("Missing or invalid index for 'mark' command! Add a valid "
+ "index for a task to mark, like 'mark 2'.");
ui.showMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
ui.showError("Index out of bounds! Try calling the command 'list' to "
+ "verify the index of the desired task.");
* The {@code UnmarkCommand} class represents a command to unmark a task in the task list.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand object with the specified index of the task to unmark.
* @param index The index of the task to unmark in the task list.
* Executes the unmark command to unmark a task as not done at the index in the task list.
* @param tasks the task list on which the command operates
* @param ui the user interface for interacting with the user
* @param storage the storage for saving and loading tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showError("Missing or invalid index for 'unmark' command! Add a valid "
+ "index for a task to unmark, like 'unmark 2'.");
ui.showMessage("Ok! I've unmarked this task as done:");
ui.showError("Index out of bounds! Try calling the command 'list' to "
+ "verify the index of the desired task.");
* The {@code Deadline} class represents a deadline task, which is a type of task with a description
* It extends the {@link Task} class, inheriting its properties and methods.
* Constructs a Deadline object with the specified description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param deadline The deadline by which the task should be done.
* The {@code Event} class represents an event task, which is a type of task with a description,
* It extends the {@link Task} class, inheriting its properties and methods.
* Constructs an Event object with the specified from and to time/date.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param from The "from" or starting time/date for the event.
* @param to The "to" or ending time/date for the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* Adds a task to the task list.

* Returns the number of tasks in the task list.

* Checks if the task list is empty.

* @return the task at the specified index
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range
* Removes and returns the task at the specified index.

* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range
* Returns an iterator over the tasks in the list.
* @return an iterator over the tasks in the list
* The {@code TaskType} enum represents the different types of tasks
* that can be managed in the Neuro application.
* Converts a string to its corresponding {@code TaskType} enum value.
* If the string does not match any valid task type, INVALID is returned.
* @param str the string representing the task type
* @return the corresponding {@code TaskType} enum value, or INVALID if the string is not recognized
* The {@code Todo} class represents a todo task, which is a type of task with a description.
* It extends the {@link Task} class, inheriting its properties and methods.
* Constructs a Todo object with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the task.
